result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Orlando N Barry in court with attorney Robert J. Baratki.  Defendant Orlando N Barry in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1 in 15CF833 & count 1 in 16CF183; DRI 15CF998.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 in 15CF833 & count 1 in 16CF183; DRI 15CF998.

15CF833 Count 1- Withheld sentence, 3 years probation

16CF183 Count 1- Withheld sentence, 3 years probation

Conditions:
Comply with mental health program at VA
Report to Turning Point Program
No drugs, no alcohol
Be involved in Domestic Violence counseling
No contact with S.P.G unless approved by agent
6 months RCJ, credit for time served to be applied if revoked
Eligible for Behavioral Health Program in Jail for AODA and mental health,  if completes the program early the balance can be stayed
40 hours of community service
Engage in Hopes Center Program for Veterans
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge in 15CF833 only
Domestic Violence Surcharge in 15CF833, waive the court costs
Court costs are waived in 16CF183
FAW
VOTE

Robert Baratki

  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Orlando N Barry
Current: 2200 Layard Ave, Racine, WI 53404 United States  (Effective: 08-28-2015)
Prior: 1613 S Memorial Dr, Racine, WI 53403

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim SPG (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
08/28/15 - BOND MODIFIED: Defendant must live on Layard Ave. May have phone contact only w/SPG. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol/controlled substance.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.
